reviews.review_msg: Very kind professor & you can tell that he is very passionate about what he teaches. Lectures can be long but are very easy to follow along. Everything on the exams was covered in class. Not difficult to do well in his course if you follow along his lectures:)
Eastern European Grandpa in the best way. His lectures are long but the tests cover exactly what is on the slides.

Lectures are filled with info and she talks way too fast, but a very good gpa booster if u work with the right ppl on group project. Criteria for project and some assignments were vague, so find smo who knows what's going on. She knows her stuff well but be prepared to leave a lot of gaps in ur notes to fill in later bc she just teaches real fast

Honestly it's so easy to forget you're even enrolled in classes with her since you do literally no work, and most of your mark is just based off of your final project done in groups. Great if you want to boost your gpa, but you probably won't learn anything

She's very nice although her lectures are not very helpful and a lot of your grade is based on group assignments which did not benefit me. And her assignments are unclear and instructions very ambiguous. She's a decently easy marker though.

Was given back a mark on a paper with very vague guidelines and deducted alot of points on concepts completely unmentioned and even contradictory with the actual guidelines given. Tried talking to TA, sent me to Prof. She initially responded, then never followed up. She then posted grades. Unprofessional handling of a grade dispute. Unacademic.

Claudia is a good teacher, but she does not explain basic concepts very well. In addition, a third of the class's grade came from a group project which was due at the end of the semester, with unclear guidelines.

This was my favourite class this semester. The concepts are really interesting, and the weekly work is a breeze. The final project seems intimidating, but with a good group it's no problem (and actually quite fun).

Claudia is fantastic and easy to understand. She doesn't embellish anything, very down to earth.

Great for TESL certificate!

Very easy GPA booster. A lot of homework, but it can generally be done very quickly. Her criteria for projects/assignments isn't very clear so it's worth it to ask about it. One big group project, but no tests.

I thought it'd be fun learning neat word stuff. It wasn't. Being half-online, the self-learning consisted of reading either Forbes countdown articles, 20-page research papers, or random Friends clips, and then writing about them. Lectures are just the same thing we self-learned. Assignments were weird w/ no examples. Still a GPA booster w/ effort.

Claudia has a self learning component which was always really disorganized and unclear but it was usually for a completion mark so that was fine. Huge group project which sucks if you don't know anyone in the class. Pretty difficult for a first year course but luckily there are no exams. Overall, easy due to the lack of tests and big assignments.

hybrid online class meant you could do work from home on your own time, and it never took me long weekly. the assignments were a bit confusing/unclear, but ok if you understood. she does not reply to emails and the slides are not that helpful, and a huge group project at the end scared me. thankful no exams! would not take again
She is unorganized and assignments are complicated. You don't even know how to work hard for this course because everything is ambiguous. If you want to get a high grade then don't take it!
GPA booster!!!! Easy if you understand concepts! Get in group projects with people that actually do work or you'll be in trouble.

She is awesome!  I am a bio chem major so ling was never something I thought id enjoy, but she makes linguistics interesting. she also brought chocolates for the final class :) The projects are super straight forward and simple, plus no final exam!!! Yay!

Lectures were encouraged but not mandatory, and I was still able to understand the material without attending the majority of lectures. Prof Wong was very understanding and always replies to emails in a reasonable time. For the group assignment we did there was a conflict between my partner and I, but the professor took care of it which was a plus

Claudia gave us no concept of what the course was really about. All of her assignments and their criteria were convoluted, she was not accessible to her students and she did not give us any idea of how we were progressing in the course, even after we asked. Super disorganized. Dont take any classes with her.

Don't expect any kind of understanding from her. Won't grant you ANY kind of extention or accept late work but also doesn't grade any assignments so you'll have no idea how you're doing. Course content has nothing to do with the assignments and the assignments are so vague that it's almost impossible to know what to do

Claudia seemed to be decent at the start... and then the semester continued. Claudia is unorganized and barely teaches. Her lectures are practically useless. She doesn't post details for assignments until right before it is due and she NEVER gives any marks. We spend the entire semester not knowing how were doing. Lastly she has quite an attitude.
great instructor, detailed weekly schedule, caring, clear explanation.

This couse has a lot of work weekly, but she always have a clear to-do list for students to follow. It actually doesnt take that long to complete. Everthing on Moodle is organized pretty well. The course is not super hard but you do need to spend some time on it. There are office hours twice a week for u to reach out live. Shes pretty nice.

Dr. Claudia is an amazing professor who was always willing to answer questions. The group project where we created our own language was fun and very easy. Weekly assessments and quizzes were easy and helped reinforce the material. Would highly recommend taking this class!!
She makes everything so easy to follow and actually enjoyable. Super clear, organized, and chill. You'll learn a lot without feeling overwhelmed. One of the best profs fr.

LING 111: Criteria often wasn't clear and differed between Dr. Wong and the TAs. Weekly self-learning assignments were really easy so there was no point going to lectures (she just reads off the slides, which are posted).

Alright prof. Does a mediocre job teaching material (reads off slides). Not clear with grading rubrics (wants a specific thing but doesn't really emphasize what it is). Otherwise it's a relatively easy class.
RUN! a 100 level course gives you a 300 level course workload. you better run!
Hes a def a good prof, and a funny guy as well ! but be ready for weekly assignments!!

Dr. Pankrats is a funny man, just a quirky old guy with a Greek accent and listening to his lectures feels like listening to your grandpa act out random stories. Lectures felt like 3 hours of nonsense though, and there was so much to memorize. I think like,, only 20 people showed for lectures each day.

Dr. Pankrats is a very funny guy, I like him as a person. But he is a terrible teacher. He does not teach the concept, but rather just has you memorize a mountain of rules, just to have enough short term memory to survive the test and to forget everything after. It is also unclear how to study, because most students are left confused.
